speech: A child runs in. There is a Serpent Guard, Ma'kar, inside.
Yes, I know. You are not to be here.
The child leaves. He meets Teal'c at the entrance to the tent. Teal'c enters and lowers the hood on his clock.
After all this time, it is really you.
We see the Jaffa Rak'nor. Rak'nor has had his gold serpent guard tattoo removed. It has left a scar.
You are the one called Rak'nor.
It is an honour to finally meet you.
We have heard much of your return to Chulak.
It is time for Jaffa to stop whispering about freedom, and begin to show our true power.
A power we can only hope is greater than that of the Gods.
Their power is real, and stronger than ever. Even Heru'ur, and the other System Lords fear Apophis. He commands the vast army of Sokar.
You know of what happened here on Chulak at the hands of Apophis.

Yes, I know how many were slaughtered. But I also know that those left alive are ready to rise against him. The Jaffa are the foundation upon which the false Gods have built their empires. We can tear them down.
To do so, we will have to fight our own kind.
As the Goa'uld have forced us to do in their names for countless generations. Only now, we will fight for the freedom of all Jaffa.
Rak'nor has the loyalty of a great many here on Chulak.

So Bra'tac has heard from you and I from him. It is the word of our friend Ma'kar that has brought me here this night. In their hearts many Jaffa believe as we do. Those with the strength and the courage must speak out. We must fear the Goa'uld no longer. Those who wish to join our cause must be united. Kol'na of the High Cliffs and Hak'nor of the Cordai Plains have already agreed to meet at the Chapa Groves tomorrow.
Then I will...meet with them as well. And this...blasphemous rebellion will finally be crushed. Ha'shak Kree!
Teal'c stands. Another Jaffa appears in the entrance of the tent. The Jaffa shoots Teal'c with a zat. Teal'c falls.
Sound of klaxons. The Gate is dialling. Hammond, Carter and Jacob hurry down the stairs from the briefing room. The Stargate opens.
Receiving IDC transmission. It's the Tok'ra.
There's no traveller en route, Sir, however there's a transmission being sent.
Looks like my vacation is over.
Carter, Daniel, Jacob and O'Neill are listening to a taped Goa'uld transmission being played back.
Thanks to our good friend, Tanith, we were able to intercept this conversation between Apophis and Heru'ur. It took place less than an hour ago.
Sounds like they've agreed to meet.
Currently, Heru'ur is aligned with the System Lords against Apophis.
Or so the System Lords presume.
Exactly. An alliance between Apophis and Heru'ur could overwhelm all the other system lords combined.

One enemy is easier to target than many. Our spies believe that Apophis has agreed to the meeting because he is willing to use such an alliance to topple the system lords. After which he will deal with Heru'ur. If he succeeds...
Find a way to sabotage the alliance.
Jacob brings up some symbols on Daniel's computer screen.
Doctor Jackson, have you seen symbols like this before?
Well, it looks similar to Phoenician letters, but I can't be sure.
We believe it is a technical manual. None of our Tok'ra linguists could translate it.
Um, excuse my denseness, but...what does this have to do with...anything?
The hatred and mistrust between Apophis and Heru'ur goes back a long time.
So if we can get them to fight each other...

They both control the two largest armies of the Goa'uld. A war between them would decimate both sides and return the balance of power back to the system lords. Which, for now, is much more preferable to one all-powerful Goa'uld.
Wait, I think I've got it! It's uh...three to the blue, four to the orange, and...and three to the blue. Sounds like some sort of colour coated combination for a lock.
Excellent! We may have a chance now. If you will accompany me.

Ah! Wait a minute! Just...stop, hold it. If you're about to say you're going to explain along the way, I'm going to lose it! I've just about had it with the way the Tok'ra do business. I wanna know exactly what we're dealing with here. Every mission detail you've got right now, or we go nowhere!
I was going to tell ya, Jack.
Hammond joins Daniel, O'Neill, Carter and Jacob at the table.

The meeting will be taking place at a region of space known as the Tobin System. The Tobin Civilization, originating from Earth thousands of years ago, has been extinct for a number of centuries, but one of their legacies is the equivalent of a large mine field in space.
As close as you can get to neutral territory, Sir.
The mines, originally designed to protect the planet, will actually hone in on a wide variety of energy signals, including that of Goa'uld weaponry.
So, if either Heru'ur or Apophis decided to open fire, they would be destroyed by the mines?
We'll take the cargo ship I came in. If we leave immediately, we can reach the minefield before the meeting, and reprogram one of the mines to hit Apophis's ship.
So, he'll think Heru'ur's behind it?
The problem is the mines are in constant motion. Repositioning themselves randomly.
So, how can you reprogram one?
That's a little bit of a concern for me, Sir.
The mines have sophisticated inertial engines that are unaffected by gravitational conditions.
Basically, we should be able to safely use the cargo ship's rings to pull a mine inside.
At which point, I'll pilot the ship to match its movements.
The Tok'ra have what they believe is the Tobin manual to how the mines work.

Yeah, unfortunately, certain aspects of the translation have previously eluded us. Now, with Dr. Jackson's help, we can use the manual to reprogram the mine to hone in on a specific energy signature. One of our operatives aboard Apophis's ship will have planted a beacon that will broadcast that energy signature.
The mine will think that Apophis's ship is firing a weapon, move towards it and explode.
Obviously, I'll need Dr. Jackson, and there might be some complicated mathematical calculations to be done, Sam would be a big help, too.
Of course, Colonel O'Neill is...always lots of fun to have around. The timing is critical, George.
Teal'c is dragged in by Rak'nor and another Jaffa. They shackle his wrists to chains hanging from the ceiling. Rak'nor storms in and throws water on Teal'c's face.
Do not think your punishment is over, Shol'va!
Back away! Welcome Teal'c! I am Terok.
Terok stabs Teal'c in the pouch with a Goa'uld pain stick. A bright light shines from Teal'c's mouth as he screams in pain.
Who do you suppose is more well known among Jaffa?
Terok punches Teal'c in the stomach.
You...or I? Terok or the shol'va?
Many know of Teal'c, but all Jaffa fear you, My Lord.
After all, I have been around much, much longer. And from the looks of things I will be around long after you've gone.
Teal'c spits in Terok's face. Terok wipes the spit from his face and tastes it, spitting it out.
From this moment on, every tear you shed will be recorded...

...so that all Jaffa alive, now and forever more, will see how weak and powerless the great and powerful Teal'c really was before he died. They'll see how he came to understand how wrong he was about the Goa'uld. They will see you pray to the Gods for forgiveness and beg to be granted an honourable death.
Let us not argue about the future.
Terok again stabs Teal'c with the pain stick. Teal'c screams as the light erupts from inside him.
O'Neill, Carter and Jacob are walking toward the elevator.
Jacob, do you really think the Goa'uld are stupid enough to fire on each other in a mine field?
No, and we don't want them to. The ultimate goal is to get them into an all-out war, where both their fleets will be seriously weakened.
You think that's going to happen?
If he thinks Heru'ur's ambushing him, Apophis will most likely retreat. However, his next move will be to order his armies to attack Heru'ur's planet.

The elevator stops and the doors open to reveal Daniel standing out in the corridor struggling with a pile of books and his bags. O'NEILL What are you doing? DANIEL I could use a hand here. [O'Neill picks up one of the bags.
Wanna try to reprogram that mine without the proper translation?
Well, I had one, I just couldn't get Beck's Ancient Phoenician Symbology on CD at archaeology.com, so...
Quite deliberately, O'Neill pushes Daniel's glasses back up his nose with two fingers.
Carter, Jacob, O'Neill and Daniel are walking up the runway. In front of them, a Goa'uld scout ship decloaks.
Still going with the gold, huh? Is there something different here?
I had the bulk head removed. Once we've moved the mine inside, we're going to need all the room we can get.
If that mine touches anything in here, escape pods aren't going to do us any good.
Daniel and Carter are sitting on the floor reading. They are surrounded by books. O'Neill is playing with the Velcro on his watch.
Do you understand any of that?
It's all Phoenician to me, Sir.
Teal'c is still shackled to the chains by his wrists. He is slumped forwards, several wounds visible. Rak'nor is offering him water.

Drink! It is only water. Do you not drink because you wish to die sooner? It is not recording now. You will not appear weak by quenching your thirst. Surely, you must realize that Terok will not let you die before he has gotten what he wants from you. I swear on my father's name that this is only water.
Teal'c refuses to drink. Rak'nor walks away.
What is the name of your father?
Swearing on his name means nothing if you do not know who he was. My father was called Delnor.
Rak'nor throws the cup to one side.
Yes, when you were first prime, you spared his life after Apophis ordered him killed.
When you turned against Apophis, my father believed it was a sign. He spoke out against the Gods, and supported you. He seared the mark of the serpent from my forehead. He...he said I was free!

Other Jaffa worriers also began to believe. Like my father, they followed Bra'tac, who said what you had done would begin a Jaffa rebellion. He said that one day, all Jaffa would be free from enslavement at the hands of the Goa'uld.
No! It was blasphemy! The Goa'uld are Gods! Look at yourself now! Why will you not admit it?
Why do you not believe as your father believes?

My father believes nothing anymore! He is dead! My father was a stupid fool, and Apophis killed my whole family because of it. He who died himself, and was reborn, returning to slay Sokar...He with the power to slaughter millions in a instant. He commands the greatest army the Goa'uld have ever known, how could he be anything but a God? I was fortunate enough to realize that in time to save myself.
Listen to Rak'nor, Teal'c! No one can save you but yourself! Not even Bra'tac lasted this long. With pitiful tears streaming down his face he admitted we were all powerful Gods!
He did die, Teal'c. But not first. First he prayed to me...prayed to the Goa'uld for forgiveness. As you will!
Terok motions for Rak'nor to remove Teal'c's t-shirt. We see burn marks all over Teal'c's body. Terok again stabs the pain stick into Teal'c'S pouch. Teal'c screams before passing out.
The scout ship drops out of hyperspace and approaches a planet in the distance. The minefield is visible all around it.
Wow. That's a lot of mines!
Hundreds of thousands. Prepare to activate the rings.
Jacob puts a control device on his head.
It's a heads-up display that'll help me fly the ship while keeping the mine centred in the hold.
And...how hard is that going to be?
Well, considering what I have to avoid out there, hard.
We see the control computer targeting a mine.
O'Neill and Daniel clear the books from the ring transporter platform. We see the computer has a lock on one of the mines.
Carter activates the ring transporter and a mine is transported into the cargo hold. It hovers low in the hold, above the floor.
Carter gathers up the equipment. O'Neill is peering under the mine while Daniel walks around it.
What, don't you recognize the symbols?
Teal'c is still manacled and slumped.
Save yourself, Teal'c! It is not too late.
Tor'ak starts to torture Teal'c with a Goa'uld ribbon device.

One second longer and you would be dead! Why admit the Goa'ulds are Gods? Why do I waste my time? Because it is the truth! I do this for one reason. Not to break you! Not to torture you! I do this to save you. Maybe you do not fear me, or even death itself, but you should fear what waist beyond if you die this way. Sha'mel kallah! Say what needs to be said to deliver your soul and the souls of all those that have embraced your sin.
Tor'ak attacks Teal'c once again with the ribbon device. Then he slams the pain stick at the recording device and storms out.
Carter and Daniel are looking around the mine.
There should be a panel that opens and allows access to the inside. Try underneath.
I think there's some thing here, Dad. Can you raise the bomb any higher?
Carter lies down on the floor and slides underneath the hovering mine.
It looks like a circle with a cross on it.
I'm pretty sure you touch it.
The last time a Tok'ra was sent to attempt this, they were never heard from again.
Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait! Wait, wait!
No, no! Sorry! That's it, I'm sure.
Carter touches the panel and it opens, almost touching her body. Inside is a circle of flashing coloured lights around a central handle.
Don't touch it anywhere but inside the opening!
Daniel lies down under the mine with the top of his head against the top of Carter's.
Um, those indicate the various frequencies the mine is sensitive to.
So we need to erase them all and input only the one we want, right?
O'Neill joins them under the mine.
How long is this going to take, kids?
Rak'nor picks up the recording device. Teal'c is hanging by his wrists from the chains.
He thought he was recording my humiliation. Instead he was only recording his own.
Do you not believe that your soul will be forever punished?

The Goa'uld are parasites. They use Jaffa as incubators until they are ready to take human hosts. I have seen the world from which they originated. I have stood beside the swamps from which they first rose. They are merely flesh and blood just like you or I!

Why would I lie? If there was a chance that they were Gods, if I thought that my soul would be forever punished, why would I lie? They have manipulated our bodies. So, too are they manipulating our minds with false beliefs!
You believe this so strongly that you risk dying in sin?
I believe it so strongly that I fight to live with every last bit of strength that I have, so that one day enough Jaffa will believe as I do...enough to end the Goa'uld and free us all forever!
Daniel and Carter are lying under the mine.
Carter turns the handle clockwise. A blue light flashes.
Carter turns the handle twice more.
Carter turns the handle four times anticlockwise.
Jacob sees a mine approaching the ship outside.
The mine starts to slowly descend closer to Carter and Daniel.
Daniel moves out from under the mine.
O'Neill grabs Carter's feet and pulls her out from under the mine. O'Neill and Carter move to safety behind the bulkhead.
I know! I have a problem here.
The mine starts to shift toward the bulkhead where Carter and O'Neill are standing.
We see the mines outside in space start to move away from the ship. The mine in the cargo hold returns to its original position. O'Neill walks to stand behind Jacob.
Someone's coming. I'm cloaking the ship.
A Goa'uld mother ship appears out of hyperspeed.
Carter turns the handle three notches clockwise. We hear the sound of a buzzer. The lights start to all flash green.
Uh, it's flashing green. Green is good?
Dad? We may need Selmak's help here!
All right. Jack? You're going to have to take the stick!
Take the helm. Keep the mine centre circle, and avoid hitting anything out there.
Jacob and O'Neill swap places so that O'Neill takes the pilot's seat.
Okay! Okay! I've got it! I got it.
I'm cool. I'm all right. It's not so easy.
Jacob goes back to Carter and Daniel. The mine returns to hovering just above them.
I think it's going to explode.
I don't know how. If you enter the wrong combination, a failsafe is enacted, and you have 5 minutes to...enter the right combination...or the...mine explodes.
Apophis is already here. If we release the mine now, and it explodes, the mission will be ruined.
And if we don't release the mine now, we'll be ruined.
We tried. What does Selmac say?
The Gate rises. Terok enters with a Jaffa. He points at Teal'c.
Two Jaffa release Teal'c'S bonds and drag him from the prison hall.
Apophis is seated on the throne surrounding by females and Jaffa.
We see Heru'ur appear on a communication screen at the front of the throne room/flight deck.
We hear in the background Heru'ur talking to Apophis. Jacob is monitoring the transmissions.
Heru'ur is saying Apophis's forces are great, but not great enough to match the collective army of the system lords. With his assistance, the battle will be swift and end in their favour.
He wants to know what Heru'ur wants in exchange. Heru'ur wants to maintain dominion over all that is currently his, plus that which is currently owned by Cronus.
He has to know Apophis will screw him eventually.
Heru'ur is offering Apophis a gift. A token to show his honor and loyalty. After Apophis accepts, they will swear an oath to solidify their bond.
Terok enters with Teal'c who is thrown into the room.
Apophis sits forward at the sight of Teal'c.
Apophis is going to think the deal over. As soon as he makes up his mind, the transfer will take place.
Uh, dammit! This is not working!
It doesn't make sense! It clearly says three to blue, four to orange, and three to blue!
How much time do we have?
Okay! These are Tobin numbers. This is 1, this is 2, this is 3...
Zero. Why didn't you say zero?
Uh...be...because there's no zero in the Phoenician numerical system.
What if the Tobins added it?
He's right! Inventing technology with this level of sophistication would require a zero.
Just trust me, it's a math thing.
So, I've been off by one this whole time?
Well, okay then, uh, uh, two to blue, three to orange and...and two to blue.
Carter turns the handle as Daniel speaks.
Now, we enter the right frequency.
Teal'c is being dragged back in. Rak'nor starts to shackle him. Terok stops him, leaving only one wrist chained.
There is little time left for you. If you repent now, I would save your soul and end your suffering.
So that Apophis can revive me, and begin again?
Teal'c laughs. Terok leaves. Teal'c falls to his knees.
O'Neill is still piloting the ship and maintaining the mine's position.
You know what'll happen to Teal'c if Apophis gets a hold of him.
Anything we do in attempting a rescue would give us away.

So, you know as well as I do that bigger things are at stake here. He's your friend, I know. But we've both had to deal with losses like this in battle situations. Tok'ra operatives have already given their lives, and others are at great risk on those ships right now. All for the sake of this mission. I'm sorry, Colonel, but Teal'c is expendable.
All right! I have to deploy.
If they start shooting at each other...
They'd better not yet. We're still in the middle of this minefield. Deploy.
The transporter rings activate and transport the mine out into space.
Our operative could have been compromised.
Or, we reprogrammed the mine wrong. No! I'm...sure we reprogrammed the mine right.
Onak la hassa, slel Apophis. Send the shol'va to Lord Apophis.
Apophis has agreed to the alliance.
Dad, Teal'c risked his life to save all of us when we came to rescue you on Netu. You owe him. We all do.
Wait a minute, how is Heru'ur going to transport Teal'c to Apophis's ship?
Well, then we can save Teal'c the same way that he saved us. By intercepting the matter stream
It won't work while the ship is in stealth.
It would take some pretty fancy flying.
We see Teal'c taking a drink of water held by Rak'nor.
I've never seen anyone endure such torture! Yet, none of it comes close to what Apophis will do to you. He will kill you a thousand times!
And you will never admit that he's a god?
The prison Gate opens. Terok and a Jaffa enter.
Take him down! The shol'va is to be transported to Apophis!
The Jaffa unchains Teal'c who starts to struggle. Terok fires the ribbon device at Teal'c and Teal'c and the Jaffa fall.
What do you think you are doing, shol'va?
Terok starts to attack Teal'c with the ribbon device.
My Lord, you are killing him!
I will not be denied the satisfaction of watching him die at least once!
Rak'nor stabs Terok in the back of the neck with the pain stick. Terok falls to the floor.
The matter stream for the transporter rings activates. Jacob flies the scout ship into the stream.
We'd better get out of here!
My Lord, a cargo ship attempted to intercept the matter stream.
We see the Tok'ra operative dressed like a serpent guard press a button on his wrist.
We see a mine heading for the mother ship.
It looks like you programmed the mine right! It's going for Apophis's ship.
Jaffa drag a prisoner in front of Apophis. We see it's Terok.
Heru'ur transported him instead of the shol'va.
We see a mine heading for Apophis's ship and exploding against the hull.
The deception is yours! Why did you not send me the shol'va?
We got to go back for Teal'c.
Ten ships decloak around Apophis's ship.
The Goa'uld have never been able to cloak an entire mother ship before, let alone a fleet!
Kree Heru'ur! Shel pac herac Apophis!
We see a glider escaping from Heru'ur's ship as Apophis's ship starts firing at Heru'ur's ship, blowing it up.
They're allowing him to escape. The sensors are picking up a glider that seems to have escaped from Heru'ur's ship before it exploded.
We can't let him get away. Onak Sha Kree! Shal Goa'uld!
(over radio) Goah Sha Kree! Loe Goa'uld!
I asked him which god he worshiped, and he answered with a Tok'ra password. This is Jacob Carter! Identify yourself!
Who are you? How did you know how to answer my hail?
I am the Jaffa who helped Teal'c escape.
We see Rak'nor in the pilot seat and Teal'c seated behind him.
It is good to hear your voice, O'Neill.
We can rendezvous on the third moon of Tichenor.
Well, I guess we've stopped the alliance.
Unfortunately, it is the worst possible result.
No. We could not have predicted that Apophis would bring a clocked fleet into the minefield.
Apophis will easily absorb Heru'ur's forces into his own. He is now a bigger threat than ever before.
